website_summaries.verdict: Pool owners with the right high-pressure water lines should benefit from its efficient cleaning cycle. Booster pump is a requirement, not a suggestion. Use continuously for all-day maintenance.
pros: High-pressure water pump cleans all surfaces well
31-ft. hose is long enough for most in-ground pools
Long-standing company has a good reputation
cons: Must be attached to a dedicated high-pressure water supply
Sometimes gets stuck in corners/remote locations

customer_reviews.title: Warning -Seller Does Not Stand Behind Produst
customer_reviews.text: The wheel fell off after very light use for one month! I had a Polaris for 8 years before any problems previously. Don't take a chance. Other reviewers and on-line. Backyard Pool Superstore who sold this is completely not responsive - here is the response from them in our on-line chat: From davidh "We are a re-seller. Our items are covered by the manufacturers warranty when you buy it. We do not have a service or technical support department. With that warranty, you have to go back to the manufacturer with issues. That's the first step. I'm sorry you have issue with that"
customer_reviews.author: murphymem

customer_reviews.title: Do not recommend
customer_reviews.text: Had this unit for one week now. Wheels will not rotate. Have tried every trouble shooting remedy in the owners manual. Called customer support. After hold of 54 minutes I was told the backup valve was faulty but company would not replace the valve unless I gave serial number of the part. There is not serial number for the part itself, only the unit. So I bought a new valve for $114 and unit still not working. Took unit to my local pool dealer. They cannot get to work either and gave up trying to get through to customer service. Returning the unit for avrefund. Will not deal with this company again.
customer_reviews.author: TJS

customer_reviews.title: HORRIBLE WASTE OF MONEY, HIGH MAINTENANCE, BEWARE
customer_reviews.text: For almost $500 you would think this would work wonders. We spend an entire weekend trouble shooting for this cleaner. It kept floating to the top. We adjusted the backup valve and thruster to every point imaginable. We moved the weights to different areas. The cleaner had pressure as we tested. It doesn't seem heavy enough to stay on bottom. So high maintenance. NOT user friendly. Watched SO MANY YouTubes and back and forth going outside and making adjustments only to come to the realization this it is a piece!!
customer_reviews.author: Chad White

customer_reviews.title: Corosion all over!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Polaris 360. I had the first one for over 10 years. About every three years I had to buy a repair kit and replace some parts. Then, finally, I decided to buy a new one. Exact same model. After only two years I have bearings falling apart because they are completely corroded. Most screws have signs of corrosion too. The odd thing is, that not all parts are corroded. It just seems that they had crappy batches of parts that are not made from stainless steel, as they should be in a chlorine environment. I still had spare parts from my old Polaris 360 and they look so much better after all those years!
customer_reviews.author: Lantern Customer

customer_reviews.title: VERY POOR QUALITY & MANUFACTURING
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in August of 2017. It worked briefly, then stopped crawling around the bottom of the pool. I had a professional open it up to check for sand or debris blocking the gears. He found the interior filled with a big glob of silicone. There is also an indication that it has been opened and worked on previously, as two lock washers were missing, but there were indentations in the plastic where they were once installed. It would appear Polaris sells their defective equipment on Amazon, or they have no quality control whatsoever. Either way, I am the owner of an underwater paper weight. I am very, VERY disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Kathy P

customer_reviews.title: Great Replacement for old Polaris
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this on a Thursday and received on Friday. Cheaper than the same one on sale at a local retailer. My pool guy suggested I order saying he can't buy them cheaper. And so nice to have a Polaris that actually is cleaning the bottom of the pool. Don't know why I spent hundreds trying to get my old one to work. As a side note: I already had a booster pump and an old Polaris installed in my pool. This was a true replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa Shannon

customer_reviews.title: An older design but still does excellent work! Would buy again
customer_reviews.text: The Polaris model 280 is an older design pool cleaner, but one which has proven its value and durability for many years. Comes out of the box ready to install and works effectively and well. This is my third unit, the others lasted from 10 to 15 years. Its easy to service and easy to repair, but it does require a booster pump to operate. My pool is 25000 gallons and its picks up debris and leaves quite well. It isn't sexy looking, won't be used in a science fiction movie about pools on distant planets, but still does the job and when purchased through Amazon I saved about $250 over the cost at the pool store. Scottsdale, AZ
customer_reviews.author: john gray sweeney

customer_reviews.title: poor quality control
customer_reviews.text: When I first assembled and tested, I noticed a leak in the last section of hose closes to the vacuum (see picture for obvious cut.) Fortunately I needed to shorten the hose anyway. Vacuum worked great the first day but on the second, it kept falling over. A quick search on the web told me that the float may be full of water. Sure enough, it has a leak as well and is full of water. Now I have to decided to keep tinkering and fixing this thing or send it back and go back to manually vacuuming. Update 7/20/20: Emailed Polaris and the were kind enough to send me a replacement head float.
customer_reviews.author: Insufficient Funds

customer_reviews.title: vendor sent renewed and new products with broken head float
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed at this vendor. I first bought a renewed cleaner which came with a broken head float. I returned and I bought a new one. For my surprise, the new cleaner came with the same issue: broken head float. Very frustrating as this is an expensive product and arrived with broken piece twice.
customer_reviews.author: VRC

customer_reviews.title: ... August 2017 and one of the hose swivels were bad. So i had to order a new one
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Polaris 280 on August 2017 and one of the hose swivels were bad. So i had to order a new one. The Polaris stopped working about a month ago. I read all of the trouble shooting tips and replaced the float, back up valve and the hose filter. It still doesn't work. The wheels will not turn and now i have to take it to Leslie pool supply to see if they can fix it. Hopefully it is covered under warranty.
customer_reviews.author: pan0825

customer_reviews.title: New and Works!
customer_reviews.text: Works just fine - I bought this to replace my Polaris 380 (? I think that was the model, which I discovered after receiving the 360) AND it worked right out of the box/no adjustments; runs well and cleans the pool. Only issue is that occasionally the tail gets vacuumed up inside the bag - but I just pull it out and all is well. I'm sure the tail could be shortened, but I don't have time to research that and fix it right now - will do later.
customer_reviews.author: SOC

customer_reviews.title: Good machine! Bag not so good, company is non responsive
customer_reviews.text: If you buy this machine it's a good machine, the bag is not sturdy at all. The zipper area seems a little faulty but needed a new one so bad, started using it and the bag ripped the first week. I left this company a message emailed them twice and no callback or email response. I didn't want to send it all back and asked if I can get a free bag. Called Polaris but so long of a wait to hold. UGH!!! purchased more bags but if you buy it maybe try another seller. They don't answer back any of the reach outs.
customer_reviews.author: Gloria McNabb

customer_reviews.title: This 360 Model is designed to work with a specific system unlike the older model I had
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't figure out why I had no suction and the sweep couldn't climb walls or get off the stairs. Finally called a service man who immediately said this is the wrong model for your system. I had no idea these were designed to work with different systems. When asking to return they said they I couldn't return as it was past 30 days. It was 13 days past the 30 day limit apparently and with this Covid 19 and all going on I hadn't been concerned about this sweep. I'm very unhappy with this service and hope they will reconsider.
customer_reviews.author: Lynne R. Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Working great - better than the 380
customer_reviews.text: We bought a house with a pool that already had the 380. Granted it was getting old, but I wasn't impressed with how it was working. When it started acting up I talked to my "Pool Guy" who highly recommended the 280 over the 380... I did it and haven't been disappointed! Easy to put together and it words great! The pool looks so much better than it did before. The only issue I saw was setting up the length of the piping. The instructions were a little confusing but I was able to reuse the old stuff. Afterwards I found some helpful videos on YouTube
customer_reviews.author: M. Weaver

customer_reviews.title: No a good first impression.
customer_reviews.text: Missing items upon arrival, no eyeball regulators, can’t block return jets, can’t run the product to clean pool. For as much money as this thing cost it better come with some pressure regulators, gotta wait for customer service to answer the phone. Will update review depending on how customer server handles this. Uodate- since the pool cleaner didn’t come with pressure regulars, and this cleaner doesn’t fit ours needs with getting the fine dirt at the bottom of our pool, we decided to return product, seller approved and it was refunded.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher baier

customer_reviews.title: My pool buddy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace the same model that was left when I purchased this pool (along with the included house) in 2017. It is a li'l dynamo. The old (very old) one was wearing out bit by bit and I got tired of replacing parts so I decided to replace the whole darned thing, What a great decision. Super easy to set up for the dimensions of my pool. I was afraid the new one would be of lower quality, as so many things are, but the it is every bit as good as the old one and my pool is happily leaf and sow bug free.
customer_reviews.author: K Robles

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this garbage!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Junk! Do not waste your money on this garbage. Would not refund our money. Buyer beware!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Yippie60

customer_reviews.title: Stays stuck in a corner
customer_reviews.text: I have owned two previous polaris pressure side pool cleaners, both were awesome, picking up so many leaves that i bought leaf bags for them, never a problem. this one picks up large particles but leaves the smaller stuff behind. My old ones had backup valves that could drag the cleaner across the pool in seconds, this anemic backup valve can barely turn the cleaner on its side. Not pleased with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis M. Andrepont

customer_reviews.title: Did not work
customer_reviews.text: This product did not work right out of the box. Float filled with water immediately. Replaced float, then backup valve broken. All Polaris would do is backup. It would run for 1 minute and the backup for the rest of the cycle which means cable doesn’t work correctly. It should backup for a minute but resume forward progress as long as it isn’t obstructed. Not the case.
customer_reviews.author: Carson

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: So far I've been impressed. This is first Polaris for me. I'm coming from a Jandy Ray vac which I loved while he was working. I need small debris pick up most and was afraid this might not get it, but it does! Only had a couple of days but so far the only thing I miss is the sleeker hose and the Jandy (Monster) sticking his nose out of the water. The Polaris 360 climbs the walls but not as high as the Ray Vac but I think it will be ok. Will update after using a while.
customer_reviews.author: Consumer 😊

customer_reviews.title: Polaris 280 Pool Vac.
customer_reviews.text: Polaris replacement for my previous Polaris 280 that lasted 14 year. I would not own a pool without one of these it makes life a lot easier. All the other fancy/expensive models cost a lot more than the 280 but this model works great. I would not waste your money. You will spend money occasionally on replacement parts for all pool vacs types as chlorine is very harsh but it is easy to maintain and parts are not to expensive. I would definitely recommend it is well worth the investment.
customer_reviews.author: Kehvn Petrig

customer_reviews.title: Shipped with fractured floater.
customer_reviews.text: This really isn't the best of their products. So far it continues to fail living up to expectations of previous Polaris 280 models. Shipped with a fractured floater. It is ruptured on the inside seam and just slides along it's side. going to the website doesn't help either. The Warranty Registration page is broken. You can't submit your new purchase to register. Amazon doesn't help with replacing parts or getting replacement parts. I expected better.
customer_reviews.author: Can't Concentrate...too many...idiots.

customer_reviews.title: Just buy a different pool cleaner
customer_reviews.text: This picked up like 5 things the entire year I had it in my pool. Never could get it to work properly, loves to get stuck in the curved corners of the pool and go around in circles to the extent of tangling the hose. I tried countless times to adjust water flow, little propeller nozzle in the back, had the pool guys look at it, endless pain for nothing. Not worth the pricey tag and definitely would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren M

customer_reviews.title: 3 months after purchase it just stays nosed in a corner
customer_reviews.text: I have had several of these through the years and they have all been reliable. This purchase, this Polaris has been a pain. Im very familiar with the model, this one doesnt behave as it should for whatever reason. Did I mention its 3 months old, I purchased it for my birthday in December. Its obviously the off season so it didnt even get much work. The belts are intact and everything appears as it should but there is zero power at the wheels. The relief valve is blowing off flow so I know the pool sweep is getting sufficient pressure, but it just sits in a corner wagging its tail. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: rocks911

customer_reviews.title: Awesome job at great price
customer_reviews.text: Awesome, I had a racer that broke after the second season. I did some research and found this classic pool cleaner is still highly recommended. Find it funny since this is then one my parents had growing up. Needless to say it does a great job and I would even go as far as saying it better then my racer. I recommend you watch the setup video, the instructions are hard to follow if it’s your first time to set one up. I am running it off my existing Pentair cleaner pump.
customer_reviews.author: TexAggie03

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy from this supplier
customer_reviews.text: When I asked to return the item the supplier addressed me first by the wrong name and then made me afraid to return the item due to their scrutiny of the product upon return. I had shortened the supply hose as directed in instructions and the price of it was $132 on amazon and I figured that would be deducted first and then further deductions from there. So my plan is to NEVER buy ANYTHING else from this supplier....their competitor “In the Swim” has always been gracious in their customer service department.
customer_reviews.author: Doc

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t have enough suction power.
customer_reviews.text: This Polaris was just not strong enough to work. I have a variable speed pump and I cranked it to 2800 rpm and still wasn’t enough. The Return line tees off from 2” to 1.5” I also have 6 return nozzles and I capped off 4. Still not enough pressure. I returned mine and just replaced the dedicated Polaris pump. It was cheaper than the Polaris anyway.
customer_reviews.author: A. Alcala

customer_reviews.title: Performs admirably when new. But not designed for endurance. Do you need a hobby and have patience?
customer_reviews.text: Works fine when new but does not age gracefully. Becomes more and more finicky as time goes on. Requiring more and more attention. Not designed for easy repair. Parts are expensive. No factory maintenance.
customer_reviews.author: Khan

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy, cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: Polaris 280 is the worst flimsy product I have ever used in my life. This product made with cheap plastic without considering quality or durability. It is a shame for an American company to selling this worthless piece of junk to its own citizen. Within the first three-month pipe broken into three pieces, followed with swing axle and the wheel. My previous pool cleaner lasted for 8 years with little maintenance. I bought this junk last year in June and I have to buy another one. I would not recommend this product to my worst enemy.
customer_reviews.author: shafiq rhaman

customer_reviews.title: Not as pleased with this one as with previous ones
customer_reviews.text: When it cleans, it’s great. One problem is that it frequently tilts to one side and rides in a circle until it’s tail gets hung up between the wheels. Not sure how to make adjustments to make this correct itself. This isn’t our first Polaris...but the first we’ve had significant problems with.
customer_reviews.author: Sidney S. Covington

customer_reviews.title: Don't do it
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this Polaris after owning one for more than 5 years that never gave us any issues. We have had to replace parts on this one 4 times now. I bought this in April 2018. Lasted 3 months and had to replace parts in the wheel housing. Then again in Jan 2019. Now we are about to have to replace the same parts for the 5th time. Do not waste your money. This is a $500 headache! Go with another brand. Polaris is cheaply made now and very unreliable!
customer_reviews.author: jenk910

customer_reviews.title: fittings not available at local pool store, product does not fit my pools connection
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately I should have spent more time on looking for a pool cleaner as the fittings do not fit my pool and the local pool store that carries this product only had one fitting. I have reached out to the manufacture serval times but the wait time is usually over a hour and I cannot wait that long. My preference at this point would be to return the unit.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Terrible product and return policy!
customer_reviews.text: This item never worked properly. The cleaner constantly gets stuck along the wall and does not reset as it should. The seller requires a 20% restocking fee on all returns which is ridiculous for a product that doesn't work properly. Avoid buying this cleaner and buy one that works better from a seller that has a more reasonable return policy!
customer_reviews.author: Diana

customer_reviews.title: Second polaris
customer_reviews.text: Was a little apprehensive to purchase this. It was shipped quickly-arrived undamaged. Set up and replaced old worn out Polaris. I can’t comment as yet on tech support for this new one. We will have to see how long it works. The old one needed new replacement parts and had lasted for many years of service. As side from attrition from cleaning our over and over-replacing expensive couplings, and new rubber tires, I would say that Polaris makes a quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work strait out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Hoses leak and sweeper keeps rolling over on it's side. 2 months later, after taking it to repair shop it works better. Even though the tech was able to get the hoses to leak less they still leak quite a bit. He said that these hoses always leak some.
customer_reviews.author: Lee B.

customer_reviews.title: Find a better product
customer_reviews.text: After owning three Polaris pool vacs, I think it’s important to point out that these are basically junk. Their sole purpose is to entangle themselves in the feed cord so as to render them useless. In addition, they constantly breakdown and Polaris charges ridiculously high prices for all of the necessary replacement parts. There has to be a better pool vac out there but unfortunately once you install the auxiliary pump you’re stuck with Polaris products.
customer_reviews.author: JKO

customer_reviews.title: Very poor seller
customer_reviews.text: It was recieved received broken and I tried to make contact with seller to trade for another non broken one. I got no response and had to go through Amazon for a refund. I still have the broken one and have asked where to return it, with no response.
customer_reviews.author: Kurt W. Caish

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy. Not what it used to be.
customer_reviews.text: I grew up with a Polaris so when it was time to buy one for my pool I went with the name I thought I could trust. Big mistake. The quality is horrible. All the plastic hose connectors broke while lightly hand tightening them which I had to do because because they all leaked causing pressure loss. Now it’s pretty much useless floating around the pool instead of rolling on the bottom. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: D and G

customer_reviews.title: it works ! Worth the money !
customer_reviews.text: Likes, works great with my out side 11/2 inch pool pump, next door neighbor had a above ground pool,junked it and gave me the pump,all ways ran off the pool pump and wall connection,this makes hooking up so much easer.I keep my pool running year around, Polaris 360 has always been my pool cleaner for 30 years,this is my second one, picks up all your leaves with no problems just dump the bag and place it back in the pool.sweeps dead algae back into my bottom drain . Also you can rebuild it your self ! Worth the money !
customer_reviews.author: Val. Jr

customer_reviews.title: All parts included.
customer_reviews.text: This was the best price around for a complete sweep replacement. As for quality, it is a bunch of plastic. The last one lasted about 6 years (with multiple trips to the repair shop). Eventually, repair becomes impractical. Bottom line is that it works and was complete. Even though this was the best price we found, it is still a bunch of money for a bunch of plastic - Oh well, another cost of owning a pool.
customer_reviews.author: hopefulbuyer

customer_reviews.title: That it cleans walls and steps along with everything else!
customer_reviews.text: I had a kreepy krawly before this and this blows the kreepy one out of the pool! This pool sweep is awesome! It climbs my rectangular pool’s walls and even cleans the steps! I had an algae problem prior to this because my old sweep didn’t move the water enough! Now I save tons of money on chlorine because this sweep moves around so much! My pool is beautiful and I am thrilled because of this Polaris sweep!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jami F.

customer_reviews.title: Stays stuck in the same areas of the pool
customer_reviews.text: I have owned several Polaris pool vacs in the past. This one is without a doubt the worst that I have ever owned. It stays stuck in the same areas of the pool all day. When I'm home, I have to keep moving it. One of the areas that it likes to stay stuck on is a sidewall of the pool - no obstructions anywhere. Also, it doesn't go toward the deep end of the pool and only stays in one direction. Quite a pain for me to have to keep moving it. Not sure if I would ever buy a Polaris again.
customer_reviews.author: MacMan56

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I got this in the spring and spent most of the summer trying to get it to work correctly. No matter what I do it still gets stuck on my steps and tends to go over the same area vs all over the pool. I've watched the Youtube videos on how to set it up, tested the wheel speed and made all the adjustments but its still not a very thorough cleaner nor does its cleaning pattern very much.
customer_reviews.author: T. Runyan

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the money.
customer_reviews.text: We are relative new comers to the world of pool maintenance, but we decided to learn by doing. Last season we learned we don't like cleaning the pool manually. Purchased the Polaris because when we moved into this house it already had the booster pump and plumbing installed. The pool stays clean with the Polaris, and even this model climbs the sides and cleans them. Anybody looking for a better way to clean the pool, this is it.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Stay Away with this product unless you are ready to repair it all the time!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this product about two years ago and it gave all types of issues since including leaking at about six months (we had to order a new pipe to replace the leaking one), and then the back up valve broken at about a year. We had to order another replacement parts... all type of hassle you could imagine. Unless you are very handy and well prepared to replace broken parts all the time for this product, stay away with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t clean well
customer_reviews.text: We bought this vacuum nearly three years ago and it has been nothing but trouble. It has come apart multiple times, and never stays connected. The joints used to put it together slip off easily. The tail comes off. It spends more time floating through the water than actually cleaning the pool. It’s suction power is just okay. The “back up return” occurs too often to even allow it to move forward and clean.
customer_reviews.author: Francisco C.

customer_reviews.title: Cheap hoses included
customer_reviews.text: The unit works well especially with the new booster pump that I had installed. The issue is that the hose that came with the Polaris 360 has broken in 2 spots and I’ve only used it for a week.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Phenomenal vacuum!
customer_reviews.text: Originally had a handheld vacuum and it didn’t suck very well so returned and spend another $300 for this! We love our Polaris! Would definitely recommend. Our pool is about 20 feet long, 8 feet wide and this guy does a phenomenal job cleaning it.
customer_reviews.author: Fileshia Walker

customer_reviews.title: Good product!
customer_reviews.text: I have had several of these 360's over the years and they have been fairly reliable. My main gripe has always been with the hoses as they don't seem to last more than a couple of years. On this new one, I just replaced the old unit with this one and it has worked perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Bates

customer_reviews.title: Sideways and broken
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum seemed fine at first, but then it started lying on its side. I thought maybe that was normal, since it was still doing a good job of picking up debris. Well, today the wheel fell off!!! I’ve only had this thing for six weeks!
customer_reviews.author: Heathergerl

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: My other sweeper just wasn’t getting the job done throughly and quite frankly, it never did. Took a chance and bought a “used, very good condition” unit. Everything looks brand new, no way this was ever used! Thrilled with this sweeper. It replaces a Pentair/Letro Legend II. After setting it up (easy) and running it for an hour, I asked myself “Why did I wait so long to switch!?!?!” Other sweeper got hung up on the steps all the darn time, rendering the sweeper useless. This one ran all day and I never saw a single hang up on the steps or anywhere else for that matter!
customer_reviews.author: A P

customer_reviews.title: Lots of issues
customer_reviews.text: I apparently should of read the reviews better. I had my pool guy assemble for me. I have had nothing but problems with it. Small wheel came apart. Had to replace a leaking hose connection. I don’t think the water bulb is working properly. Wall attachment doesn’t seal completely. I should have bought locally and it on Amazon. Lesson learned.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Installed Quickly and Easily
customer_reviews.text: Our ancient 280 finally gave up the ghost this spring. We knew it had to be replaced quickly to clean the debris in our pool after opening. The old one came with our house/pool and we liked it so much that we had no problem making the decision to purchase a new one. Very little assembly required. The hose is a perfect length for our 22 x 44 pool. We attached it to the wall port, flipped on the booster pump and it took off! Within an hour the pool bottom was spotless. The new 280 has a much larger debris bag; a nice feature.
customer_reviews.author: Prudence Sweeney

customer_reviews.title: Does a Fantastic Job and a Great Price
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this Polaris 360 Pressure side vacuum to replace my old Polaris Pressure side vacuum. My old Polaris was the type that floated on top the pool and the vacuum bag swam at the bottom, the main issue of that vacuum was that it did not do a good job of vacuuming the shallow end of the pool, it did fine in the 8 foot deep end. This new Polaris 360 covers the whole pool and the best thing about it that it does not require a booster pump. Using it so far for almost a month with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Keywest

customer_reviews.title: Woks great.
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement for our old 360 model. It was very easy to install and worked perfectly right out of the box. I rated the suction power based strictly on how well it cleans since there is no way to actually measure it or compare it to other cleaners. I think it's a bit pricey, but if it lasts as long as our old one it's worth it.
customer_reviews.author: David L. Kline

customer_reviews.title: Keeps getting tangled and floats
customer_reviews.text: Hose constantly tangles. Does not stay on the pool ground and float ball is full of water and cannot be emptied. Please see video review.
customer_reviews.author: Loloi

customer_reviews.title: Good device when not swolloging it's tail
customer_reviews.text: Works pretty well except for constantly swallowing its tail... The idea of a scrubber brush on the tail makes perfect sense until it, like the tail, continually ends up in the collection basket. That said comparative reviews suggest that is still the unit to beat for it's reasonable price and ability to work getting stuck occasionally instead of all-the-time.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald J. Ellis

customer_reviews.title: Better than more expensive pool vacs!
customer_reviews.text: We had this model since our pool was installed about 12 years ago. We had to replace some stuff over the years but it worked great. When we finally could not keep rebuilding it, our local pool guy talked us into buying a Dolphin, which was about $900. It was horrible! Left it on for hours and hours and still had debris in the pool. We returned it and bought a brand new Polaris (same model as from 12 years ago!) for half the price and we have a clean pool again!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa G

customer_reviews.title: Best upgrade
customer_reviews.text: Wow what a difference an upgrade can make. We had the older version of this sweeper that had seen better days. The improvement was unbelievable. Easy to install should note we have an auxiliary pump
customer_reviews.author: Nancyp

customer_reviews.title: Do not purchase this!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought it 9/7 used it for 3 weeks then closed the pool. Opened the pool 4 days ago & it doesn’t work. What a bummer! $400 down the tubes & with Covid pool items aren’t “essential” so 10 days to get a new one. Total waste.
customer_reviews.author: An Amazon Fan

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and working well
customer_reviews.text: We bought the Polaris 280 as a replacement for another Polaris unit we had owned for years. The new Polaris was easy to install. I watched a helpful video on YouTube and followed the instructions. After I plugged in the cable, off it went. We have owned the new unit for six weeks and have no real complaints, we have to untangle the cable every so often. The unit picks up everything. The pool company we use to maintain our pool recommended the 280 but wanted $1,000 to install it. I decided to save money by installing the unit myself. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: David Lindsay

customer_reviews.title: Best vac I've ever had
customer_reviews.text: The Polaris 360 easily connects to a dedicated pressure line and is suitable for all in-ground pools. It sweeps, scrubs, and vacuums all surfaces of the pool. It comes with its own filter bag. The Polaris Vac-Sweep® 360 can clean without the need for a separate booster pump.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent

customer_reviews.title: It's priced decently well for the job it does.  It's definitly a well made product.
customer_reviews.text: We need a pressure side cleaner for our pool. We have used quite a few different models over the years. This one seems to do the best job and last the longest. It's not the easiest to set up but once you get it adjusted correctly, you shouldn't have to mess with it for years. Once the hose starts breaking after a few years, save yourself some time and replace the WHOLE HOSE. If you replace parts of the hose, more parts will continue to break since it's most like worn out.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Something is wrong with it.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this Polaris not even 2 weeks ago. It hasn't worked right from the beginning. It falls on it's side and gets stuck that way continuously. It also sprays water out of the joints of the hose. I don't know if that's contributing to the problem of it falling on it's side or not. Someone suggested buying a replacement part for maintaining balance. I'm not up for buying a replacement part for something 2 weeks old. I'm not sure who to contact for assistance since it's sold by Amazon and not Polaris. We may be returning it. If we get it working correctly, I'll update my review.
customer_reviews.author: Knsmith

customer_reviews.title: Replaced old 280 and this one works fine
customer_reviews.text: I like the simplicity of these models and this one works just fine. Installation took about 10 minutes. Make sure you CUT THE HOSE TO THE PROPER LENGTH when you install.
customer_reviews.author: HoustonTexansfan

customer_reviews.title: Hook up was easy with the use of a You-Tube video as the ...
customer_reviews.text: The Polaris 280 came as scheduled. Hook up was easy with the use of a You-Tube video as the directions that came with it were somewhat vague. So far the sweep is running smoothly and cleaned the bottom of the pool perfectly even picking up some very small debris that had accumulated. I previously had been using the Hayward Phantum, but it was continually in the shop and when not in repair was constantly tangled in the hose. Also spent quit a lot of money on parts replacement. Looking forward to hopefully having a better experience with the Polaris after hearing the good reviews!
customer_reviews.author: Michele

customer_reviews.title: Broken - DAY ONE
customer_reviews.text: This happened day 1 of purchase. It worked great for a few hours. I made sure setup was done properly, pressure was correct and did everything that was suggested. About 4 hours into use, the hose becomes detached (in the middle of the hose, not from the pool hookup) all of a sudden. Now after I reattach it, every time I turn the pressure back on - it comes apart again and obviously isn't of any use whatsoever. For being the "best pool cleaner brand", this is just pathetic.
customer_reviews.author: Zach

customer_reviews.title: effectiveness of this unit
customer_reviews.text: It does not do the whole pool. It's just all over the place going sideways and upside down and then gets stuck on the side of the walls of the pool. I've read the instructions and adjusted this and adjusted that and it still does not work properly. I would not recommend this 360 Polaris vac.
customer_reviews.author: Emanuel Gagliano

customer_reviews.title: Polaris makes the best pool cleaners
customer_reviews.text: We like it so far. On in for a couple weeks and it’s working great. We love Polaris. Bought another brand last time and suffered through a few years of it. Finally replaced with a Polaris. We’re told this model was better than the newer ones so we went with it. Doing a nice job so far!
customer_reviews.author: Triple L

customer_reviews.title: Great Pool Cleaner
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Polaris pool cleaner we have owned. It works great, gets leaves and palm tree debris out of our pool. Hubby likes that it works on pressure instead of suction. Keeps debris from going thru filter, making it easier to maintain. We have had a couple of different types and this one works best. Our pool is 20 x 40, so a lot of area to clean. Doesn't climb as well as we would like, we have two Baja decks in pool that usually just require a quick sweep to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret Yeargan

customer_reviews.title: This is a very good product that works perfectly.
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, when when I installed it, it worked well for an hour then laid on its side and spun in circles. I went through the trouble-shooting guide and nothing fixed the problem. So, I went to Leslie's pool Supply and asked what they thought the problem was. They suggested that the float was cracked. I bought a new one, installed it and the cleaner has worked perfectly ever since.
customer_reviews.author: Richard A. Shaw

customer_reviews.title: Constantly gets hung up
customer_reviews.text: Revising my review. After 2 seasons I can tell you I have never purchased a more worthless product on Amazon. I made the mistake of keeping this and trying to make adjustments, I did all of the online suggestions. Nothing has works. It gets stuck in 1 place constantly, when I do free it it may just sit there for a while, then, randomly starts moving again before getting hung up somewhere else. How I wish I had returned this. I would encourage you to move on to something else. This is truly a very bad product.
customer_reviews.author: David N. Neal

customer_reviews.title: So Active It Seems Alive!
customer_reviews.text: We replaced our old Polaris with a new one when the replacement of parts became cumbersome. This new one is very good. Pool is definitely clean every morning. One complaint is the collection bag has a zipper instead of Velcro. That would be easier but the zipper often sticks. Doesn’t open smoothly. Back to Velcro, please! Otherwise we like our “sea monster” as the grandchildren call it.
customer_reviews.author: FloridaSunshine

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put into action
customer_reviews.text: Received this product yesterday afternoon and put it to work this morning. Product was very well packed and instructions are fool proof. Great product!!!! I will update later if my opinion changes, which I don’t think it will.
customer_reviews.author: jason hersey

customer_reviews.title: When it's workung it's great. But it spends half the day stuck on ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this less than 3 months ago. When it's workung it's great. But it spends half the day stuck on our stairs. At least once a day I have to go out to the pool and removd it from the stairs. But, a couple of hours later it gets stuck again. SUPER FRUSTRATING!!
customer_reviews.author: Pink Thursday

customer_reviews.title: Works like a champ
customer_reviews.text: Replaced my old unit, since replacing parts continually got to be too expensive. The only thing I don't like is the Velcro bag. Won't last long. I keep buying the bags with zippers, they last much longer and are sooo much easier to clean out. The original Velcro bag, very hard to clean out, when shaking out the Velcro closes up, very impractical and time consuming. Zipper bags 100 % better. Only 3 stars due to the bag issue
customer_reviews.author: Abidehandy

customer_reviews.title: Proven Success Record!
customer_reviews.text: I've used Polaris 280 cleaners for many years. When my alternate brand cleaner failed, I was advised by a pool professional that the 280 was the only cleaner I needed and he was right. As the owner of several pools, new and used over the years, I used the cleaner that came with the pool until it failed and that was usually prematurely. I always replaced the other brands with the 280 when they stop working. The Polaris 280 out-performed them all. You can buy fancier Polaris cleaners with more bells, horns and whistles but, for my money, the 280 is the most reliable, cost-effective and best working of them all.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Cunningham

customer_reviews.title: Keeps pool clean
customer_reviews.text: Had one before. Lasted about 8 years. Worked very well sucking up dirt and leaves that collected in bottom of pool. Pool was always clean..works better than other brands of pool cleaner. Never got stuck in corners , steps or maindrain. Required some maintenance but was normal wear and tear. Parts easily purchased on Amazon. Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Charles D.V.

customer_reviews.title: product description on Amazon incorrect
customer_reviews.text: The writeup on this pool cleaner says "no booster pump needed". I received the machine 3 days after I ordered it and the first thing I saw on the package was "works with booster pump". Installation was easy but I could not get the right wheel rotation without using the booster pump. Seems to be working OK except that incorrect description eats at me. Glad I did not disconnect the booster during installation like I planned.
customer_reviews.author: mad at LG

customer_reviews.title: Beware of this seller; warranty is horrific and will pass to manufacturer.
customer_reviews.text: I would rate the seller of this product as a “0” as the item in question has a wheel that fell off as well as a broken connection piece. I have contacted this seller and they simply pass it off to the manufacturer as opposed to helping in-house. For someone to spend almost $500 for a product that should last many years to be told “sorry, we cannot help you beyond ten days” is unethical to say the least. Purchase elsewhere....
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: and I felt that I could never just relax and enjoy it, because I could never get it clean ...
customer_reviews.text: Let me be clear...last summer, I cleaned my pool weekly myself. It was hours of brushing, skimming, vacuuming, and I felt that I could never just relax and enjoy it, because I could never get it clean enough. This year, I run the Polaris a few hours every other day, no work at all, and the pool is always pristine. It. Is. Worth. Every. Penny. I think it's better than the robots (mine broke down after only one season, and it cost over $800), and MUCH better than doing it by hand. Pretty, right?
customer_reviews.author: Belinda J Watson

customer_reviews.title: Picks up sand and small debris very well.
customer_reviews.text: This is a good little pool vac and it's working well. One thing I don't care for us the Velcro closing on the bag. The tiny bits of debris that the vac picks up get caught in the Velcro and it's hard to clean the bag thoroughly.
customer_reviews.author: Linda C

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Pool Cleaner
customer_reviews.text: We've used the Polaris Vac-Sweep 280 for many years. It was finally time to replace and we find it is still a highly recommended model. We purchased from Save More On Pool Supplies at a good price. Unfortunately the wheel was damaged in shipment but the company responded quickly with good communication and we were able to return and get a full refund. We will buy again!
customer_reviews.author: C S

customer_reviews.title: Ball float on the vacuum was cracked.
customer_reviews.text: The vacuum came on time and all was good except the the ball float on the back was cracked and let water inside so it swam sideways. Since I needed it now we went to a store and brought a new one. It was aggravating. For so expensive it should have all worked.
customer_reviews.author: K. Kent

customer_reviews.title: Nothing but problems!!
customer_reviews.text: This pool cleaner has been nothing but problems; it gets stuck all the time in the conners of the pool and also doesn't climb very well. Now after almost a year the cleaner is not running around the pool but doing a wheelie in one spot. For such a high price and so many great reviews I'm very disappointed!! Buy at your own risk.
customer_reviews.author: Trust me

customer_reviews.title: Worth. Every. Penny.
customer_reviews.text: I was reluctant to spend so much money on a plastic contraption, but after 1 month of pool ownership I was so tired of coming home from work just to clean my pool by hand. This thing is worth it's weight in gold! I have a 14k gallon pool and only a 3/4hp pump, so I was worried the Polaris wouldn't work without a booster. It works great! It doesn't climb the pool walls (which is fine) but the pool is still spotless. All I do anymore is empty the skimmer basket, check chemicals and add as necessary. If you are on the fence of whether it's worth the cost, don't hesitate to pull the trigger on this!
customer_reviews.author: Brenden

customer_reviews.title: Be mechanically enclined.
customer_reviews.text: Once I comprehended the instructions on installing it did the job better than my old one which has been a good one. I called the number for assistance in installing and was 27 in line so I hung up and used trial and error and finally got it up and running. This is my third Polaris since 1983 that I have used.
customer_reviews.author: Daphne V.Bible

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: Old unit was 7 years old. I had repaired rebuilt and generally done what I could to make it work. New cleaner was a game changer. Don’t delay order it.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 3 months
customer_reviews.text: It never worked quite right compared to our original Polaris. It does not clean the entire pool, suction is weak, gets tangled by itself... and now it has stopped working. Seeking warranty support and we'll see how this turns out.
customer_reviews.author: RX7ANDY

customer_reviews.title: The product I received had been returned once before
customer_reviews.text: The Polaris 280 is a great product. However, the one I received had a broken wheel bracket ( back wheel fell off when I pulled it from the box). I robbed a bracket from my old Polaris and while replacing it I realized that someone had previously removed or replaced the same bracket ( the screws were scarred up so to speak). Nonetheless this product was not direct from factory in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Travis Knezek

customer_reviews.title: Bad quality!
customer_reviews.text: Bad quality! It not clean the whole pool! Only turn small circles, bad return policy, you can not return after use one time!
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: This is a good product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after asking my pool service company which one they liked. They definitely endorsed the 280. I am very happy with how clean it makes the pool.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Kingsbury

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: It’s not perfect, but it’s good. And a deal comparatively. The bag is pretty tight, so it does hold dirt. Recommend
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Works Perfectly to Clean All Pool Sizes
customer_reviews.text: The Polaris 280 is my go to for pool cleaning. I've tried the 360 and the 3900 versions but was disappointed with both due to parts breaking on them more frequently than the 280 that has been around forever. We have a large pool, 65,000 gallons and this little guy just works. After having my other 280 for nearly 10 years, running nearly 24/7, it was time to get a new one. Within a day of putting it in my pool the 280 had it spotless without ever getting tangled up. Remember, this pool cleaner does require the booster pump to operate!
customer_reviews.author: Bryan S

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely the best!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely the best cleaner we have ever owned, we had the Kreepy Krawler, KK II, ray vac, blue racer. All junk compared to this Polaris. Should have done this years ago. I did not rate tech support because I did not need them.
customer_reviews.author: Nugglutz

customer_reviews.title: Received a damaged unit
customer_reviews.text: We had a hard time getting this to work. We made adjustments, yet it still would not remain upright, Upon closer inspection, we realized the float part was cracked. When I went on their tech support website and clicked on the Chat button, I received an "Oops that page is not available message." Not good. I emailed the company and am waiting for a response.
customer_reviews.author: Frances R. Josephsen

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy
customer_reviews.text: Awesome Cleaner. Been working for first 2 months without issue. Just be sure to cut the hose length to within 6" of the longest length of the pool. It will pull out any hose loop that may occur. Walks up the walls some as well. The bag cleanout is a bit tedious but manageable.
customer_reviews.author: Craig J. Karst

customer_reviews.title: there is nothing better for the money"
customer_reviews.text: when we moved into our new house, we already new that the sweep was broken and would need to be replaced. I asked our pool company what we should use and without any hesitation he said "Polaris 280, there is nothing better for the money". It's been running every day for a couple of hours and keeps our 25,000 gallon pool completely clean, which is a tough job because we have an overhanging sycamore tree that is dumping leaves and seeds on a daily basis during the fall. Time will tell of it keeps on going and doesn't need repairs in a few months but so far I'm completely satisfied with it.
customer_reviews.author: Alistair B.

customer_reviews.title: olaris Vac-Sweep 360 Pressure Side Pool Cleaner
customer_reviews.text: good product ,but I am disappointed they delivered the machine and left it at the gate where anyone could have picked it up being that close to the road left the gates wide open so that they could put pool cleaner on the porch , good thing I was home and saw it out there
customer_reviews.author: Maureen Murphy

customer_reviews.title: My old model would work like a champ taking everything into the capture net and ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this unit to replace my now 8 year old vac which is the exact same Polaris. I am not sure if the product went under a modification but this replacement does not work as well. My old model would work like a champ taking everything into the capture net and did a fabulous job. My new one seems to stall after any amount of sand starts to collect in the bag, It does an OK job but still disappointed as I was hoping for the same results .FYI, I also made sure my pump pressure was at a level necessary to operate the vac which is important to know.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Bertrand

product_meta.title: Polaris Vac-Sweep 280 Pressure Side Pool Cleaner, 280 Model
product_meta.description:
Size:280 Model| Style:Cleaner

The Polaris 280 pressure-side pool cleaner
(view larger). The Polaris Vac-Sweep 280 pressure-side pool cleaner works in all in-ground pools and requires a booster pump. It is powered by double jets, providing greater vacuum power and faster cleaning (3 hours or less). The Polaris 280 easily connects to a dedicated pressure line and sweeps, scrubs, and vacuums all surfaces of the pool. The pressure cleaner is equipped with a single chamber filter bag where it captures large debris such as leaves, acorns, pebbles, and other small to large debris. Its unique filter bag removes debris before it reaches your pump basket or filter, prolonging the life of your filtration system. 

The 280 requires a separately available booster pump, such as the PB4-60. Polaris pressure pumps are specifically designed to operate your cleaner at optimum cleaning efficiency. The compact, rugged design allows for maximum performance.

WHAT'S IN THE BOX
280 Pressure-side pool cleaner; 31-foot hose kit; single chamber filter bag; and operating instructions

ABOUT POLARIS
Polaris cleaners are the number one recognized brand of pool cleaners worldwide and have enjoyed 40 years as the top selling pressure pool cleaner. The new robotics from Polaris display the same high quality engineering, rugged construction, and reliability that pool owners have come to expect from the brand. Polaris Pool is part of the Zodiac Pool Systems, Inc. family of products for the pool and spa.

280 PRESSURE SIDE POOL CLEANER
AT A GLANCE
 * Powered by double jets, cleans a pool faster (3 hours or less)
 * Works in all in-ground pools of any size and shape
 * Unique filter bag removes debris before it reaches your pump basket or filter
 * Sweeps, scrubs, and vacuums the bottom and walls of your pool
 * Includes 31 feet of feed hose; equipped with single chamber filter bag for capturing larger debris
 * Runs off a booster pump (available separately)
feature_bullets: Polaris Vac-Sweep 280 pressure side pool cleaner
Works in all in-ground pools; requires Polaris booster pump. Pool Type / Surface - Inground / All
Palletized in multiples of 16 units ;TailSweep PRO Compatibility-YES
Ready to connect to 1.5-inch dedicated pressure cleaner line
Includes 31-feet of feed hose.Vacuum Inlet:2.25 inches
Compatible with model Polaris 480 and 280 cleaner. NOT COMPATIBLE with Polaris 360 and 380 model pool cleaner

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars3,571 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
